program_overview.title: Family Adoption Programme (FAP)
program_overview.objective: To provide experiential learning in community health and develop socially responsible healthcare professionals

year_1.focus: Understanding social determinants of health and basic family assessment

competencies.competency: Demonstrate understanding of social determinants of health
competencies.description: Identify and describe how social, economic, cultural, and environmental factors influence health and disease in the adopted family
Perform systematic family registration, household survey, and basic health assessment of all family members
Assess household environment including water source, sanitation, waste disposal, ventilation, and vector breeding sites
Maintain accurate and complete records of family health data using standardized formats
Interact with family members with empathy, respect for cultural beliefs, and maintain confidentiality

specific_learning_objectives: Understand the concept of family as a unit of health care
Identify family structure, composition, and life cycle stage
Assess socioeconomic status using Modified Kuppuswamy Scale
Identify environmental health hazards in the household
Understand health-seeking behavior of the family
Recognize cultural and religious factors affecting health
Document baseline health status of all family members
Establish rapport and trust with the family
Understand ethical principles in community health practice

expected_activities.description: Complete household registration form with demographic details, family composition, and socioeconomic assessment
Conduct comprehensive household survey including housing, water, sanitation, waste disposal, and environmental assessment
expected_activities.deliverable: Household survey form with observations and photos

expected_activities.description: Conduct initial health assessment of all family members including vital signs, anthropometry, and health history
expected_activities.deliverable: Individual health assessment forms for each member

expected_activities.description: Apply Modified Kuppuswamy Scale to determine socioeconomic status
expected_activities.deliverable: Completed Kuppuswamy assessment with score and classification

expected_activities.description: Write reflective entry on first family visit experience, challenges faced, and learning points
Compile comprehensive family health profile including genogram, family health tree, and identified health problems

year_2.focus: Comprehensive health needs assessment and intervention planning

competencies.description: Identify health needs across life cycle stages using appropriate assessment tools and screening protocols

competencies.competency: Identify health problems using clinical reasoning
competencies.description: Analyze health data to identify priority health problems and their determinants
Develop evidence-based intervention plans for identified health problems and implement feasible interventions
Plan and deliver health education sessions on priority health topics using appropriate methods and materials
Explain national health programs relevant to family health needs and facilitate access to these programs

specific_learning_objectives: Conduct life-cycle specific health assessments (infant, child, adolescent, adult, elderly)
Screen for non-communicable diseases (hypertension, diabetes, obesity)
Screen for communicable diseases (TB, leprosy, vector-borne diseases)
Assess mental health using validated screening tools (PHQ-9, GAD-7)
Conduct nutritional assessment and dietary counseling
Identify high-risk individuals and conditions
Develop prioritized problem list with clinical reasoning
Plan evidence-based interventions for identified problems
Deliver health education on priority topics
Link family to appropriate health services and schemes
Understand and apply principles of behavior change communication
Monitor intervention compliance and outcomes

expected_activities.description: Conduct age-appropriate assessments for each family member (growth monitoring for children, NCD screening for adults, geriatric assessment for elderly)
expected_activities.deliverable: Completed assessment forms with auto-calculated results

expected_activities.description: Administer PHQ-9 and GAD-7 to adult family members, interpret scores, and identify those needing referral
expected_activities.deliverable: Completed screening forms with risk stratification

expected_activities.description: Compile comprehensive problem list, analyze determinants, and prioritize based on severity and feasibility
Develop detailed intervention plans for top 3 priority problems including objectives, activities, timeline, and expected outcomes
Conduct minimum 3 health education sessions on topics relevant to family needs (e.g., diabetes management, hygiene, family planning)
expected_activities.deliverable: Session plans, IEC materials, attendance records, feedback

expected_activities.description: Implement planned interventions, document compliance, and monitor progress
Identify eligible family members for government health schemes (PMJAY, PMSBY, pension) and facilitate enrollment
Participate in village/ward level health assessment and identify community health priorities
Write monthly reflective entries on learning experiences, challenges, and professional growth

assessment_criteria.program_linkage: At least 1 family member enrolled in scheme

year_3.focus: Continuity of care, outcome evaluation, and comprehensive reporting

competencies.description: Provide continuous, comprehensive care to the adopted family over 3 years with regular follow-up and monitoring
Assess effectiveness of implemented interventions using objective indicators and document health improvements
Identify a community health problem, design a simple research study, collect and analyze data, and present findings
Organize and lead community health activities such as health camps, awareness campaigns, or screening programs
Compile and present a comprehensive report documenting 3-year journey with the family including assessments, interventions, and outcomes

specific_learning_objectives: Demonstrate sustained engagement with adopted family
Track health parameters longitudinally (baseline → follow-up → endline)
Evaluate intervention effectiveness using objective indicators
Document health improvements and positive changes
Identify persistent challenges and barriers to health
Conduct community-based research on priority health issue
Organize and lead community health activities
Develop comprehensive family health report
Present case study to peers and faculty
Reflect on professional growth and competency development
Demonstrate cultural competence and ethical practice

expected_activities.description: Conduct comprehensive endline assessment of all family members using same tools as baseline for comparison
expected_activities.deliverable: Endline assessment forms with trend analysis

expected_activities.description: Analyze baseline vs endline data, calculate outcome indicators, and assess intervention effectiveness
Design and conduct a community-based research study on a priority health issue identified during FAP
expected_activities.deliverable: Research report with methodology, findings, and recommendations

expected_activities.description: Organize a health camp in the adopted village/ward providing screening, health education, and referral services
expected_activities.deliverable: Camp report with attendance, services provided, and outcomes

expected_activities.description: Compile comprehensive report covering: family profile, baseline assessment, problems identified, interventions implemented, outcomes achieved, lessons learned
Present family case study to department highlighting key learnings, challenges, and outcomes
Compile complete portfolio including all assessments, interventions, reflections, certificates, and evidence of competency achievement
Write comprehensive reflective essay on 3-year FAP journey, professional growth, and impact on career aspirations

assessment_tools.purpose: Document all visits, activities, and assessments
Assess clinical reasoning and presentation skills
Assess specific competencies in standardized setting
Assess depth of understanding and competency
